title.value: Устойчивость экзогенных стадий Strongiloides papillosus к неблагоприятным факторам внешней среды
Resistance of exogene stages of Strongiloides papillosus to adverse factors of the environment
Resistance of exogene stages of Strongiloides papillosus to adverse factors of the environment

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Patafeev, V.A., Vitebsk State Academy of Veterinary Medicine (Belarus)

abstract.value: With the purpose of definition of eggs, larvae, males and females stability of S. papillosus free-living generations to low temperatures and its hibernation opportunities outside of cattle-breeding rooms in February, 2008 in clinic territory of parasitology faculty of the Vitebsk State Academy of Veterinary Medicine outside of cattle-breeding rooms have been incorporated 20 tests of excrements in weight on 100 gram. The data received at research, have shown, that infective larvae and eggs of S. papillosus are more resistant to low temperatures than rabditiform larvae, as well as male and female free-living generation. At the same time it can be concluded that the eggs, larvae, males and females are free-living generation of S. papillosus outside livestock premises in the Republic of Belarus during the winter die. Use of the NV-1 at a concentration of 2% with an exposure of 5.5 hours will release the animal from the premises at all stages of development strongiloides and thus prevent re-infection of animals.
